Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus, the sentence begins with the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Therefore, my sons, since I have committed this book to you, which is the last in the science of medicine, by its completion it shall be completed through you, and by its explanations, and by its declarations, it is evident to me that I commit this treatise on surgery to you.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since surgery is almost completely abandoned in our region and in our times, it is greatly endangered by peril, and the science of it is lost; there remains only a few small descriptions in the books of the ancients, which are misunderstood and lead to error and confusion before their intentions and power are understood and their art is extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It appears to me that I will organize this treatise in the second way, through explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because it comes with the shapes of the cautery tools and other instruments of the work, along with the addition of the declaration, and the preparation of them, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	However, the reason that a good craftsman is not found with his skill in our times, is because the art of medicine is long and requires its practitioner to be exercised in the science of anatomy, which includes understanding the joints and forms of the members; knowing the connection and separation of them; having knowledge of bones, nerves and ligaments, their number, and their function; and the origin of blood vessels, quiet vessels, and pulsating ones; and the location of their emergence.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And as Hippocrates said, "A name is nothing, but in the work it is much, and especially in the art of the hand."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	However, we have already said this in the introduction of this book; because whoever is not acquainted with what we have said about anatomy, is not fit to avoid error and risk causing death for men, as I have seen many times, because some are uneducated in this science and abandon it without its knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because I saw a foolish and experienced doctor make an abscess called scrophulus on the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries in her neck, causing a large amount of blood to flow, which resulted in the woman dying among others.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who took out a stone from a man's body that had been suffering from the disease for some time, and the stone was large; he came to him and removed the stone with a piece of the bladder, causing the man to die on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I myself called for it to be opened, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, it was clear that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took payment from a duke of our land for surgery, and he treated a blacksmith who had a fracture in his thigh; and the doctor prepared himself with his ignorance, cut open the fracture with pulvines and pins with strong construction, but did not let the wound breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Approach the wound according to their wishes, and close it, and let it dry for several days and command that we unbind it; and this way it will be until the flesh and limb are healed, and it may lead to destruction.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	Then you should be called to it, and prepared to undo the bandage, and wait for peace and let him endure his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But corruption was already confirmed in the member, so it could not be stopped, and the corruption spread through the member until the patient is in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another doctor found an abscess cancerous, and it became ulcerated near some days, until the evilness of it was magnified by its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the cancerous tumor is full of melancholic humor, so it may not spread to everything, but only to an area that suffers from it all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my sons, it is necessary that the operation be divided into two divisions: one is the operation associated with health, and another is the work in which there is the greatest risk of danger.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already experienced this in all places of this book in which there is an operation in which there is error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against this and let go of it, so that the fools do not take a wrong path and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons with solicitude and with the protection of God, and your patients with happiness and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Take the best path for God's grace to lose and attain salvation and laudable succession, and leave behind the terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and withdraw your weapons from what terrifies you, so that examination in your faith and in your name does not mislead you: for more remains for your glory, and thus also in this world and forever to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gaulia then said in some of her monasteries:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat evil illnesses, so that bad doctors are not named".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and it starts with the first section of the first division.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered for the foot, in the forms of instruments and in the ironwork of the cauteries, and about what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second division.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of cysts and perforations, and of abscesses, and of plagues, and of extraction of sacs and similar to those, all in one chapter and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third division.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is ordered for the restoration and dislocation, and cure of twists and similar to those; the chapter is divided into the foot, and forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cautery with fire and acute medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	It begins with the treatment of everything in the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary that I say the quality of the benefits and harms of this cautery, and in what kind of circumstances cautery should be prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I will say that the discussion of the benefit of cautery and its harm is a long, intricate, and subtle discourse, and secretly hidden; and many wise people have spoken about it, and they have disagreed with each other, and my words are among the few of theirs, fearing tediousness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cautery applies universally to all matter or substances, except for two cases, which are cases of caution without substance.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the case of dry and desiccated matter with substance, there is disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial in this case, while others say the opposite, that cautery is not appropriate for illnesses of quality and desiccation, because the nature of fire is of quality and desiccation, and it is appropriate that dry and desiccated matter that is cauterized should be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say the opposite of that, that cautery is beneficial in all dry and desiccated illnesses that come into the bodies of men, because when you compare the body of a man and the humidity in it to the nature of fire, you find that the body of a man is extinguished by fire.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say through the discussion of this, that I have experienced this myself on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But it is not necessary that this comes to the one who has already been explained and practiced in the chapter of cautery in a previous exercise, and has come to know the diversity of the cases of men and the disposition of illnesses in their bodies, and the causes of these, and the accidents of them, and the time span of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other cases, there is no fear for you, and especially in cold and wet illnesses, because all doctors have agreed on these, and there is no disagreement about the benefit of cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Understand, sons, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it is above cautery as medicine burns, is because the fire is simple, its action does not extend to the member being cauterized except for minor harm to the adjacent member.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine spreads to the member adjacent to it, and strong heat brings the disease in the ill member to worsen and accelerate.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not accomplish this; it is already known to us through experiment and the long duration of study on the art concerning the truth of causes; and because it is not lawful for me to reveal my secret hidden in the fire, and the quality of the operation of it in the body and its expulsion of diseases, philosophical demonstrative speech, which could sharpen your thoughts, I shall abstain.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Understand, sons, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to perform cautery and pause in the best time of springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is appropriate in all times, because the harm caused by an accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what the cauterization achieves, and especially if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, fistulas, which cannot tolerate delay, it is feared that the evil of those who come with malice, which is greater than minor harm entering through the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not think in your thoughts, or sons, that this is not believed only by the common people and foolish doctors, because the remedy of that illness which is cured with cauterization does not work at all times, and they pause due to its consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they think, because cauterization is not simply a medicine that alters the complexion and dries the moisture which is the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cauterization exceeds medicine by the desire for its value and virtue of its operation and the greatness of its Lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the illness may return at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of their illness, and the virtue of it, and what is prepared in the body of them due to the accumulation of superfluidities in them, and what is obtained for them through their diet and similar things; but that the illness in which cauterization is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluidities and moisture, such as cauterization of teeth for pain, it is possible that the pain will not return there, but only something small may occur.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But the common saying is that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, and this is not the right one, as I understand it, because I believe that it is not healing which benefits from medicine or any other reason for caution.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is in opposition to this; and I understand that the saying "cauterization is the last resort of medicine" is not because we administer the methods of healing for some illnesses, and those medicines do not confer improvement, but rather when the end of the illness has been reached, cauterization is administered and improves it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here onwards, understand that cauterization is not the last resort of medicine, not according to the meaning which I understand by the common people and the flocks of foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and its sublimity of substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the location of cauterization does not make any difference, because this is not absolutely true, as I already have proven and discovered that it does not do anything except in some bodies, and cauterization with gold is better than with iron as they said; but when you perform cauterization with fire and gold, it is not declared to you, because it depends on the amount of gold that you want according to its cost, and it prepares to receive friction; if you place it on fire some layers so that the artificer can work with it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, cauterization with iron must be done more gently and more carefully in the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cauterization according to the chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that I alleviate the demand for it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterization for pain in the head due to coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is for the coldness and moisture in the head, which is the cause of the swelling and multiple abscesses called corissa, from the forehead to the hairline and flowing ears, and multiple sleeping, and toothache and headaches, and generally of all illness that comes from coldness, such as paralysis, sodium, apoplexy, and similar ones in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, you command the patient to be evacuated with a purgative medicine cleansing the head for three or four nights, according to the strength of the illness and the age and habits of them.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Approach and command him to shave his head with a razor, and then have him sit on a chair and place his hands on his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then pause your hand at the base of your palm above the nose between your eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the place you mentioned is reached, mark it with a probe, and then ignite the olive oil cautery which has this shape:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place it on the marked spot and press down gently so that it descends, while your hand should be gently tightened around it, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand slightly and look at the spot, if you see any part of the bone exposed, as with grains of sand, raise your hand again, and if it does not turn back, use another tool, if it is frozen, until the bone that I told you about is visible.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take some salt and dissolve it on the spot and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place it over the burned area in bandages and leave it until the scar from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the location with a strong four-part medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	It has been said that when the wound remains open, the best thing to do is to apply honey, as it is better and more helpful.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	Some have said that the vertebra should be cauterized to the bone, and the cautery should be held in place until a piece of the spinal cord is burnt off.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then scrape away the part that is touching the bone and treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Some have said that when the cautery reaches the nerve, it should be pressed into the bone forcefully until the bone cracks, and this is the shape of the probe:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that the vapors from the head will exit from that spot.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	The wound should be kept open for a long time and treated until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, in my opinion, these two types of cautery are not beneficial to everyone, but only to certain individuals out of fear; and you should discard it, because it is better for the patient's health when possible, as the head is more susceptible to damage from prolonged heat due to its constant exposure, especially if the patient has a frail constitution.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion; and from that point on, avoid this procedure for the sake of the patient's health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter two.
Del cauteri del cap.	On head cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and prolonged pain occurs in the entire head of a patient, and it is treated with lancets, hooks, capirushers, ointments, plasters, guaze, needles, blisters, and similar remedies, especially if cauterization has already been attempted but did not improve the situation, then consider whether the patient's head is naturally strong or frail; if it is strong, do not hesitate to cauterize again with a different cautery tool.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Approach the cautery to that spot on his head and use it until the scalp is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Measure the amount that has been calculated and make an incision in the scalp to expose the bone at that location, which is called the "foramen" - this is the location where a ventous vein is usually found. Then use a cautery to burn and seal off the wound on the back of the head where the incision was made.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	Then release your hand from there, and do not expose the bone, as the patient will experience a great pain different from the pain caused by other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	Tell the assistant to place this cautery in its location, as the cautery used for burning the corners and top of the head is more subtle than the one used for other locations on the head; this is the correct way to do it.
Capitol ters.	Title: Tightening
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Treatise on Modern Migration Cauterization
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is persistent pain in the scalp or spreading pain into the neck, medications that modify the head should be administered along with other treatments as I have described in the treatment of diseases; if this does not help, then cauterization should be done in two ways: either cauterization with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Take a salve of alum, scour it and remove the edges of both sides with a knife.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Approach the location of the pain on the temple with a thin lancet and make an incision until it penetrates deeply enough to create a small cavity, but ensure that it remains hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Place a piece of damp cloth over the area with strong compression and leave it for three hours; then remove the alum, let the wound heal for two or three days, and place a plaster over the moistened area until the spot turns black.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Cure that which is inflamed until it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medications that I have written about in the second treatise on burning medications.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Cauterization with iron can be done in this manner: fire for the cauterizing tool, and here is the method for that.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called claus clavilhs (key nails), as the tip of it is shaped like a clove with some curvature, and in its middle part there is a small elevation.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Place your hand over the location of the pain, and hold it there - to prevent the archery that is about to come from being disturbed - and rotate the small iron tool slowly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the quantity that is pressed by the scalp in this manner is too large and causes bleeding, raise your hand to ensure that the artery, which is nearby, is not pressed, preventing blood flow.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Approach a wound with salt water and cover it over the area, leave it for three days; then approach with a linen cloth stitched, and treat it with oil until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	If you wish, cauterize the end of the swordsmith's finger according to the cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery during this modern procedure.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Title: Ancient Cauterization of Hernia.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When treating a hernia with the remedy you have mentioned in the previous cure and in the section on diseases, and if that treatment does not help, and sometimes because of the illness that does not respond to the remedy you have mentioned for the first cautery or the cauterization with fire, then it is necessary that you heat the cauterizing iron until it becomes white-hot, because this signifies the spot of pain marked with a line of appropriate size, and if that cannot be done, hold it for a moment and then pierce the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful about the continuation of the jaw, which must remain healthy for chewing, and that the ligament is not adhered and the nerves that are near it, and that no spasm occurs.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the care and caution of blood flow from the artery that is cut off, because in the cutting off of it there is fear, especially for those who do not know what they are doing and are not careful or experienced; leave the operation for a while at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find the regulations for dealing with blood flow from an accident of the artery according to its method, in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	If you see this illness that does not respond to the cautery and if you find the body of the patient tolerable, cauterize it in the middle of the head as we have recorded, and heal the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	If you wish, administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on arterial constriction with cauterization using two knives, and this cauterization is more effective and appropriate.
Capitol .v.	Fifth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Title: Cauterization of Earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is cured by medicinal causes or other treatments as mentioned in the section on diseases, but the pain persists, then burn the cautery, which is called a point, and this is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Approach the point towards the burning, and place it around the entire ear as a wheel is rolled, or in the circle of each example if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	With the cautery of the ear lance slowly, little by little, because you will feel the place where to stop.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	If the cautery of many points is performed on the entire ear, and this is done, then heal the areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Sixth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Title: Cauterization of Torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture which is cured and treated with cauterization is nothing but the species that come from the plague, as we have mentioned in the section on diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species that enter by dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When treating that species of torture with jars, poultices and liniments, and if your treatment does not work, then it is necessary for you to cauterize the patient with three cauterizations: the first one is the lancing of the ear, the second a small one at its temple, and the third the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Pause your cautery on the contrary side of the affected area, because softening does not occur except in the affected part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is to cauterize it on the right side of the affected area, placing a small piece of charcoal on top of its head and another on its temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the finger used, and stop your hand with the cautery until the amount of the substance of the burn has been burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, it belongs to the blacksmith, its shape is like a table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is very delicate, and care must be taken to avoid excessive roughness in it; cut the knife thinly in it.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area until it has healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the ancient method of cauterization for apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and the patient's condition is stable and they do not have a fever, then cauterize it with four cauteries: above all on the corners of their head; also on the forehead and the sides of the head as described before; and on the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of cauterization is as previously described.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	It has already been cauterized on the stomach opening, and it is later; take care of it as prescribed by the doctor.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the method of cauterization for forgetfulness caused by a blow.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient large and round pills in the beginning, as they will soften them.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And shave the entire head of the patient and stop at the neck, applying the plaster described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Wait for several days, because this is the method of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do as the doctor orders, which has already been mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if the patient recovers well in this manner, then stop the treatment; otherwise, perform three cauterizations on the lower part of their head, starting from the highest point on their head and moving down towards the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Wait between each cauterization for the duration of the finger used, and take care of the cautery as prescribed.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	However, if you wish to increase the treatment and the patient is tolerant of it, cauterize in the middle part; otherwise, cauterize on both corners.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Take care of the treated area until it is healed; make sure that the olive oil-based cauteries are as described earlier.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the method of cauterization for relief and softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should perform the softening treatment on the patient's head with jars and as previously described; shave the head of the patient, cauterize in the middle part of their head with a cautery, cauterize around all the corners of the head, cauterize at the base of the neck, and apply three cauterizations to the cervical vertebrae.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	If it is necessary for the treatment of severe softening of the body and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize the affected area with four cauteries on the lumbar vertebrae, and then cauterize again until the burn has penetrated deeply, and raise the hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And apply care to that which is to be healed, and this should be olive oil cauterization.
Capitol .x.	In the tenth chapter, it is written:
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the Cauterization of Epilepsy
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epilepsy is not cauterized but rather that epilepsy caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to treat the brain of the patient at the beginning with oil and with the other treatment which has been said in the division when the patient is strong and tolerates the exception of medications.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	If the patient is a child who does not tolerate medications, then administer gruel and gruel-like foods that are easy to digest, with the intention of improving their diet for several days.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the head of the patient, then cauterize that area with a cautery in the middle of the head according to the method previously mentioned, and another cautery on the occiput of the patient, and over each ear cauterize as well.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	If the patient is strong and tolerates it, then cauterize that area with the cauteries which have been mentioned, achieving paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae in the neck and the vertebrae in the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use olive oil cauterization as previously mentioned.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause with a subtle cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	In the eleventh chapter, it is written:
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the Cauterization of Melancholy
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humors and thick phlegm, then cauterize that area with the cauteries which have been mentioned for achieving paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	If the cause of melancholy is excess declining into melancholy and the patient's body is moist, then give them something to drink that cleanses the brain as has been previously mentioned in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the head of the patient, then make an incision in a circle around it, and then pause that incision in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	The patient should be held securely on all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then pause with a lint dressing; it is also appropriate for use as an old sheep's balm.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat that area over the fire at a suitable temperature, which the patient will tolerate when it is applied to them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then apply that over the middle of the head in a circle and leave it in place until it is soaked through.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Give that to the patient every week once, with the other treatment for their good health until they are healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area making small points as much as possible, but always have a well-ordered cautery at hand: this is the specialty of cauteries which moisten the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then pause that area in a cloth or bandage made of woolen thread.
Capitol .xii.	In the twelfth chapter, it is written:
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the Cauterization of Water Dropping into the Ear
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have recognized the onset of water in the ear through the signs which I mentioned in the division, then begin and give the patient something to drink that cleanses their head, and keep them away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	Let them bathe in warm water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then tell them to rinse their head and cauterize that area with a cautery in the middle of the head; then cauterize that area with two cauteries on each temple if it is the onset of water in both ears, or one cautery if it is the onset of water in one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make incisions with a cautery on all veins and arteries that have already been tied off; let the cauteries be in a line at the level of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Be careful of blood flow when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from it, apply some medicine to stop the flow, which is within your ability.
