However, if you fear that the plague may spread to the main members (i.e., the large intestines), then it is necessary for you to immerse wool in boiled oil or unboiled oil and place it over the area between the anus and the scrotum (i.e., over the lower abdomen).
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if there is pain or putrefaction in your bladder (i.e., the urinary tract), because it has become pus-filled, then you should cauterize that with black sticky vinegar, and especially if the pustulation occurs in the bladder and a puncture is made to penetrate into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	You should know that healing from the large bladder (i.e., the urinary bladder) is easier than healing from the small bladders (i.e., the ureters).
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the bladder that is called "gugunu" does not receive healing from plague that occurs in all parts; and this is due to the large number of veins that are in it, its size, its subtle nature, and its proximity to nerve tissue.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	If what proceeds from the wound is linen, and you can obtain it recently, roll it up according to your rule as you do with hernias.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	If it has passed a long time and it becomes black or green, then you must apply a tight ligature to the affected area, so that blood flows out, because in linen there are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then insert a ligature at that place where the wound is located, and pause the ends of the thread hanging from the incision, so that the attraction towards it may be alleviated. By pulling on the linen and releasing the pressure of the wound.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Recalling wounds when they occur in the hernia.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When there is a small disruption in the hernia, it is possible to restore it in some men, because I saw one who was repeatedly wounded in his abdomen with a lance and had a wound on the right side of his stomach, and the wound was old and had turned into a fistula, and exudation from it and foul smell.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Therefore, I continued the treatment since it was not completed in healing, but rather continued to cauterize the area where the fire healed and the location was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I saw the location already consolidated, and advised the patient to avoid any further injury to his stomach; no one should suffer from this unfortunate event and disrupt their daily routines of eating and drinking, and instead take a bath and rest.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced individuals have said that when a small wound occurs in the hernia, it is necessary to tie it as follows: take large grapes; then align the two lips of the wound and place one grape with its mouth open over the two lips of the wound; when you press on it, separate the head from it, because it adheres and does not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And pause another grape near the first, and do not continue to make one grape after the other according to the size of the entire wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And tie that one and close the wound; keep the attached heads in the hernia until the hernia is healed; do not harm the patient with any inconvenience.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible to tie the hernia with a thin thread made from an animal intestine, because it is finer; and take the end of these threads from the intestines, which should be devoid of flesh, and tie the end of it with a thread wrapped around it, then insert the thread into needles and sew it to the hernia, and reduce it in the disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of stitching with grapes is not reliable or trustworthy.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the wound is large and wide, especially in one of the delicate hernias, then it is not repair, but rather cauterization, and not healing from all aspects.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Treatment for abscesses and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that any wound or abscess that becomes old and is not healed and remains wet all the time and does not drain off, whether it is in any part of the body, is universally called a fistula and we call it an abscess.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	A fistula, according to truth, is a hard, white nodule, without pain and with a concavity similar to the concavity of an ulcer; and it is therefore called "rizzated abscess", i.e. ulcer.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in some men it is a wet fistula that drains pus; and its moisture is discharged in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture moves, and it is small, thick, and thin.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	I have already mentioned in the division, when I spoke of wounds, that any ulcer that is not healed or is not in raw flesh is not this but one of these causes: either because there is little blood in the body; or due to malignancy of it; or because between it and the lips there is tough skin prohibiting the growth of flesh; or because it is a moving abscess; or because the ulcer itself produces pus and the material sent to it is of poor quality; or because the medicine is inappropriate for its treatment; or when corruption occurs in the region, and it is pestilence; or due to the nature of the region, such as Saragossa, where digestion of diseases is difficult, and the healing of abscesses by nature is slow; or because there is one bone, or many bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have shown all these causes, their symptoms and the treatment of them in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	Therefore, it is necessary for you to know the treatment of fistulas, which is performed by operation with a surgeon.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all parts of the body; for they are fistulas that reach large veins and arteries, or nerves, or the bladder, or the hernia, or the bladder, or one of the ribs, or one of the vertebrae of the spine, or one of the joints composed in such a way as the hand and the foot; and they are those that provide proximity to the main member and similar ones.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And thus that fistula which follows this method belongs to difficult-to-heal ailments and does not receive cure, and care for it is labor and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	If the depth of one of these fistulas does not reach these places as stated, and you hope for its healing and believe in it, and wish to understand more about it, then take a probe or iron, and if the fistula follows a straight path, touch it with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is twisted, then examine it with a probe of fine lead, because lead has the lightness of its body, and is easily curved to follow the twists.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has moving painful parts, it is not possible for you to probe it.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Therefore, cauterize the orifices with cautery, because the moisture you use to cauterize one will go to other orifices and spread from them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	Then you must examine carefully, according to the method that is possible for you to determine if here you have bone or nerve, and whether the fistula is long or short in cavity, or is a fistula with many orifices and lies completely beneath the maximum of your strength, your questioning, and the examination of the patient, and the discovery of the pain must be your compression on the area, and similar to the signs and causes accidental to an abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all those causes with true vigilance, then proceed to the healing with confidence: and it is that you consider whether the fistula is apparent near a salt spot, far from a joint, or of nerve, or artery, or vein, or one of the places which I told you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you dry out the fistula according to what was said before about its nature, and stop that which is in its filtering and corrupt flesh, and that which is born in the orifices of the skin, or flesh, or similar, and cure it within until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of deep length and follows a straight path, it is necessary that you incise it into the preon as far as possible for you, and clean out all its corrupted flesh; and administer warm poultices covered in acute medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have enclosed with iron.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And leave it for a few watch-periods until the acute medicine has eaten up all that has been rotten in the cavity of the fistula due to corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	Then restore it with healthy substances which produce healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then cauterize it according to the method you have recommended.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and it is necessary for you to certify this, then examine it and dry it out according to the method you have recommended, if you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as you have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is discovered and there is corruption and blackening in it, then cut it out until the corruption is completely stopped; and treat it with something that causes flesh to grow on it until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and discharges pus as before, then you know that you have not completely eradicated the corruption; and therefore investigate again with great care, make the reasoning for it and clean it with your last strength, and restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And thus if it is healed, that is good; and if not, then you know that the corruption is deep within the body, which you have not reached, and in that case, you can do nothing but let it be.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small or it can be shot out, then shoot it out with fine forceps suitable for that purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if the bones are moving, then you must perform a precise removal of all of them, and leave no cause for them with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any cause of the humors opposes you and in its incision there is no fear or error, then incise the liquid or flesh here, and deliver the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones at your time, then stop over the wound as much as possible, and leave it until the surroundings of those bones become flesh and liquid, and guard the wound that is not consolidated, and constrain the incision which you have made during your operation.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Therefore, if you fear, stop over the wound submerged in hot oil, or a wound submerged in strong Egyptian ointment, or one of the green poultices, for when they are heated, the liquids separate from the bones and their abscesses are drained, and the attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the thigh or hip bones or similar to those, and what is rotten from it is only the face of it, then cut out the rot only from behind until the blackness and corruption is removed, and restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If what is corrupt in him is large and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it becomes necessary to close and completely excise that and the surrounding tissue where the corruption has occurred, and then care should be taken to heal it when it has been consolidated.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	Recommend to you that which happens to a man in his private part for him to restrain and assist with your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man around 30 years of age suffered pain in his testicles and from inside the scrotum there was pus-like matter that had spread into the body interior to the scrotum, this matter is abscess with large abscess, and it is not external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	Therefore, the time was extended by the error of doctors until the abscess had matured, and then the matter emerged, and its healing was delayed until the scrotum became fistula, and you must make incisions in the pustules that all got pus and the humidity of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Then many doctors treated it for about two years, without wisdom but in skill, until I was summoned.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the scrotum of him and the matter that flowed from those pustules through a large wound, and the body of that man was completely stabilized and his color was yellow.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted a probe into one of those pustules and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then I approached and examined all the pustules and found that they were connected to all parts of the scrotum.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I cut into one of those pustules until I discovered a bone cavity, and found that it was corrupted, and it was already hard and corrupted and rotten; and a part of the scrotum had already been corrupted to the extent that it had penetrated into the muscle.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I removed what was discovered and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I found that it was not in the bone but that corruption which had been excised and removed, and I had already drained it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And I placed the restoration of the wound with a consolidating medicine for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And I examined again and found over the bone according to the previous finding, and found continuous corruption around the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	I removed what appeared to be from that corruption, and then I was determined to perform the healing and restoration of it, but it did not heal.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I examined again and did not stop cutting the bone little by little specifically and continued the restoration of it, and it did not heal until I cut around an inch of it, and that extracted with its marrow, and I restored it with medicine, and it was consolidated slightly and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	The operation and section of him was not necessary except for the provision of the firmness of it and due to the scarcity of his tolerance and fear of death, because he suffered in all hours due to excessive loss of syncopes.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Therefore, it is healed completely and there is nothing in the bone marrow; the arrangement of it was good in his body and the virtue of it returned; and it was kept in its arrangements and no harm was done to him in any way nor any injury in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in the body broken, then it becomes necessary that you cut it in this way: and it is that you take hold of it firmly at its extremity and command someone to stretch it out; and place a strong linen bandage on top of it; and place it over the flesh that is left behind the bone, and extend the extremity of it so as to pull the flesh apart, and you discover the flesh over the place which you want to cut, so that the cut does not injure the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And stop a table or board behind the bone properly, because when you do this, it is not forbidden to cut through the corrupt flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And it is necessary that the cut be made over the corrupted place little by little, because if it is in the depression of the corrupted bone and does not appear in its appearance to touch, and perhaps another examination will be needed.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is rotten and not prominent, then one part is continuously connected to the other, and the corruption is at the same place or in a part of it, then you discover all the flesh; and stop a table behind, and cut from the first part where the corruption is until the cutting of the other part is continuous.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And make the cut according to the location of the corruption, as mentioned above.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is at a joint, cut the corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is connected to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not rational but artifice.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	If the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is difficult; however, you must investigate the corruption in what way it appears to you, and cut it open, clean it according to each arrangement that is possible for you, and with each artifice be corrected, provided that it does not harm veins or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	Know what the saw-like instruments are for cutting these bones and which saws should be used on these bones depends on the position of the bones, the preparation of those bones, and their thickness and fineness or coarseness; therefore, you must prepare all types of equipment suitable for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	E sapias that the operation signifies to you the type of instrument that is necessary; when indeed, you are skilled and experienced in the ways of this art, and witness to the methods of illnesses, therefore now you must choose for yourself what is suitable for those instruments in every disease.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	E thou should make at the end of this chapter, the number of instruments which you will use as simple ones with which you will perform the prohibition that you will experience on others.

Forma de autra serra:	Forma d'altra sega:

Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	La cima di questo raggiello ha la forma di testa di chiusura a stella, e le punte sono come quelle dell'astaferaggio.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	E non bisogna che le parti di congiunzione siano conforate se sono corrotte o la bocca è larga.

Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another saw-like instrument; this resembles a ray, and the end of it is like a saw, and it is used in many places in the joints of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a rasp-like instrument that serves to cut through the bone:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its end is triangular and sharp-edged.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made of iron from India, and it resembles all the causes that we mentioned for rasps, scissors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision and the cutting through of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The incisions can be caused intrinsically or extrinsically, or when you have treated a corruption and the cure does not help, or the corruption spreads to a member that was not affected by any cause, then you must make an incision in the member to the depth of the corruption, so that the patient escapes death or a greater evil that is more harmful to the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of this is that the member turns black before it can be burned, or it may become black to the depth where the corruption enters the member and takes hold of the entire body; therefore, you must make an incision in that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the corruption is caused by poison from certain venomous creatures such as scorpionfish, viper, or rattle snakes and similar animals.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	If the corruption or poison is at the end of a finger, then you should incise the finger and not give space to the corruption to enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it reaches the hand, then you should incise the arm at its joint and do not give space to the corruption to enter into the elbow of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it swells up (the corruption), then you should incise the arm at the shoulder joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	If the corruption spreads beyond the shoulder and sometimes surrounds it, then in this case the patient is at death's door; and administering another cause for treatment is as good as nothing.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, if the corruption spreads to the foot and swells up the toe, then you should incise it at one of the joints (of the toe).
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	If it starts climbing up the foot, then you should incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it climbs into the ankle, then you should incise the calf at the ankle joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has reached the ankles, then do nothing but dismiss the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The method of incising or sawing a member is that you strengthen the ligament on the side where you want to make the incision, and strengthen another ligament on the other side; and extend one ligament away from the incision site, and extend the other ligament over it; and separate the flesh between the two ligaments with a spatula until all the flesh is exposed; and then make an incision or saw.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary to place a layer of cloth over all the incision sites to protect them, and bring the wound to the patient dressed and covered with a cauterizing dressing.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs while you are working, then you should cauterize the site immediately, or apply some astringent powders to stop the bleeding; and return to your treatment when it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And place the affected member in appropriate bandages and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend that you place the patient's foot in a splint for this accident that we both recommend, which is when the blackness occurs in the patient's foot due to burn-like blistering.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first appears at the toe and tends to spread over the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Therefore, the patient must prepare himself by putting on thick socks to protect the foot from the intensity of the pain and burn-like blistering, and then incise the foot at the joint and heal it.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that insidious corruption occurred in the finger of the hand, indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And so it was with me, and I performed the necessary removal of that superfluity over the hand with the application of medicines, and the superfluity did not recur and began to spread to another finger starting from the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he called on me to incise the hand of that person, but I did not want to do it because of the risk of recurrence of the superfluity, and instead I feared the incision of the hand would cause death, as the patient's strength was failing.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And so he lost hope in me and returned to his homeland, but I learned that the man had prepared himself and incised his entire hand, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And this narrative is not meant to be read as entertainment but as guidance for dealing with this illness and as a sign of the significance of such treatment.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Treat the wound properly and carefully, using appropriate cleansing solutions and medications.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in any fleshy member and the space of the abscess is prolonged until pus collection occurs, then it is broken and perforated, and the pus is released from it, leaving a hollow cavity behind like a vessel, covered with thin fabric such as linen, and no secondary corruption occurs, and no pressure is applied to the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called sinus, and not fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	If the space is prolonged before corruption affects any member, it is called a fistula and not a wound.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The treatment for it is that the wound is stitched up in the same way as a loop is turned, and especially when it becomes thin and is sewn with linen, making sure it does not stick to the place due to corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the wound will stick and if corruption has not yet been achieved by a wrong sequence of events, and there is swelling in the wound, then you cure it with a suppository.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the mucus that comes out of it has a fetid odor, then you purge it with an Egyptian remedy which is made of oil, vinegar and ginger, which are ground together and divided into portions, and put in a container, and placed over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and reaches the desired consistency.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; purge the sinus with this, strengthen its opening, and leave the medicine inside for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then extract it with care; do this for several days until the sinus is purified and the odor has subsided.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	Sometimes it is purged with water made from ashes, when this medicine is not available to you; and you take the ash of burnt wheat, put it in water, let it settle, then collect it and purge the sinus with it until you are confident that the sinus has stopped.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine or water made from ashes, then purge it with water and honey mixed with ginger crushed, or with vinegar and honey mixed, for by nature honey is cleansing and washing, and vinegar makes the sinus adhere, especially when there is an excess of bitterness and dryness in the vinegar.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this for some days and are confident that the sinus has subsided, then purge it with a liquid that makes the flesh come out of it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you take diaphonicon, dissolve it in oil of roses and vinegar of bitterness; or you purge it with various medicines and other remedies that have the properties I have already written about in the treatise on clysters.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and the canula of the clyster cannot be received in it, then you gradually widen it with a small iron, pausing when it is covered with Egyptian or basilicon oil until it is sufficiently widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	Similarly, if the opening is wide, then you stitch up the lips of it with suture and leave it in a size such that the clyster does not protrude from it.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening of which the mucus comes out is elevated at the partings above it, then dry it in the pus-like place where it is located so that the mucus flows back inside, because when the mucus is obstructed in the sinus, flesh is generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the sinus inside the bone pus-like area as you wish, then prepare the member by preparing it with the preparation that allows the mucus to flow out easily and without being obstructed by any cause of the mucus.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines that are placed on the sinus as needed, so that they extend over linen fabric.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	The linen fabric should be of such size that it communicates with the entire sinus; and then insert a larger, slightly longer probe into the right opening of the sinus using forceps; and extend another linen fabric of the lion's oil over this linen fabric according to the length of the probe, and place it on top of this for a long distance from the opening of the sinus so that the discomfort of the mucus is relieved from the area and the linen fabric does not become too large, but rather every few days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But the one that is over the opening of the sinus, which you always wash to let out whatever is inside it.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	So that you know if what comes out from the mucus is liquid or solid, or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And with this you observe the location of the sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess there.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this way, and the matter that was deposited on the opening of the sinus has already adhered or shows signs of adhesion, then you should loosen it or wait three days, and when the wound is loosened, then change the linen fabric for another and renew the oil.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if the sinus has a long space with subtle virus, do not despair of its adhesion, for healing is approaching, because some men have slow regeneration of flesh in their wounds and this is opposite to that.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the sinus has been discharging undigested mucus for many days, then you know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and this is prolonged, then you adjust it with a drying treatment, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their effect, they should be dried as with diaphonicon, when there is excess addition of zinc.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	The patient's last aid is to take a thick, dissolved defugation in rose oil and place it on the affected area, and then bandage it using that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	When there is no other remedy, take thickened honey and apply it; or take myrrh and aloes, grind them all together into a powder and sprinkle it over the heated honey, then draw a line with that mixture onto linen and strengthen it with wax; draw a line on the honey-covered area that you have thickened, and sprinkle more of the powdered mixture onto linen and strengthen it again.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	When used occasionally, administer the long-term aristology of celestial lily (which is celestial lily) and flour made from fennel seeds and centaury, and use those simple ingredients or adjust as necessary, grind them and sift them into a powder, sprinkle that over the honey.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the sinus prolongs and is not cured by this treatment, then know that corruption is in its front part, and it starts to attack the bones or other hard parts or ligaments; you should treat it with fistula treatment, as described above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Treatment for paronychia and cuticle removal, nail trimming, and incision.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Paronychia is an abscess that arises under the nail of the toe or finger, and it grows stronger in other places, and when prolonged and its cure is delayed, it can become an abscess or rot, and it eats away at the root of the nail, rotting it completely, and its corruption spreads to the bone underneath, making the end of the finger putrid, and the color becomes dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Therefore, when you have the above mentioned condition and your treatment does not improve, it is necessary that you cut off all the excess rotten part of the nail and cauterize the affected area with hot iron, as cauterization is helpful in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is healthy and the nail is sound, but the additions of the nail press the skin at the sides inside, and it starts to hurt and swell there, you should pause a thin needle at the angle where the nail penetrates the skin, push it through, and cut the affected skin with ease, and pause medicines containing corrosive substances on what remains of the skin until it is completely healed; then treat the area with an ointment until it is cured.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If corruption has already entered the bone, you should cut and extract it because there is no cure for a rotten bone.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If the corruption and rot are spreading in the finger, you should cut it open at one of its nodes according to its memory (meaning: where it hurts most), and then treat the area until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If the nail has been percussed or crushed, and pain is very intense, you should first anesthetize the patient, then cut the nail with a sharp knife in a transverse section from top to bottom, but make sure that the cut does not reach the skin below the nail, because it will cause severe pain to the patient and can lead to the growth of superfluous tissue at the site; then treat the area with what relieves pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Adjusted digit (a common condition in many men), which is entirely flesh, and it is very strong in bones, or it is very strong in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some are born with the condition of the joint, or they have it in the knuckles of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	A person born with a condition of the finger knuckle is not ill, but one who is born with a joint disorder is sick.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	For those who are born with fleshiness, the section is easy, and it should be cut with a thin knife.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for those who are born with joint disorders, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of an abscess forming there.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	For the one born with a condition of the finger, it is necessary to first cut the skin around the knuckle with a round incision into the bone, then use a suitable saw and treat the area until it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Consolidation that happens in the fingers due to various conditions or by birth of the person with such condition, or due to plague consolidation or burn from fire, or similar, it is necessary to cut off that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Place a thin layer of lead between them in rose oil to prevent them from easily consolidating, or separate them with a piece of thin fabric until they are consolidated as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	Similarly, if there is consolidation in the palm of the hand, you should cut off that consolidation according to its preparation and the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Incision of vessels results in varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Vessels are varicose veins, which are large swollen veins filled with melancholic waste that move in the body's members, and their greatest danger is in the legs, especially in travelers, laborers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer the body's purge of black bile some times with strong expulsion, and return blood to the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The cure for them is according to two methods: the first one is that it should be cut and the black bile extracted, and the second method is that the vein should be raised and everything removed.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is performed according to this method: first, the vein should be wrapped with warm water until the thick black bile is dissolved, which is mucus from the vein, and then tightly bind the patient's leg above the knee and below the groin with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one, two or three places, and cut the vein widely, and raise the black bile with the patient's own hand from below the vein upwards and downwards until the desired amount and the number of times you want to extract it have been achieved, and the patient's condition will improve.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then tie it up, and order him to avoid foods that produce black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full, and you notice this in the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The raising of the area is performed according to this method: you should wash the patient's leg if there are sores, and then immerse his leg in warm water until it swells up and the veins are filled; or exercise it with strong exercise, if washing is not available, until the member is softened.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And cut the cordon on the side of the vein in a long or short incision, depending on whether it is on the right side of the vein or the left, or at the bottom of it you must do this.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And open the cordon with scissors and expose the vein from all sides until you can feel it, and you should know that the pain decreases when it turns black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And since it is swollen and you see that the cordon is white, you should open the cordon and expose the vein.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then you should place the lance beneath it until it is raised and displaced from the cordon, and suspend it with a lion's claw.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And cut another incision opposite the first one for three fingers' width, and expose the cordon above the vein up to where it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And raise that and incise the lower incision at the bottom of it, and extract that and raise that up to where it comes out through the second incision, and extract that from the incision above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until the entire cord is extracted from the higher or lower incision or all of the incisions, until it has been completely removed; then close that incision.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	If you find that it is difficult to extract and raise, then insert a strong double-edged needle and tie it off, or place the lance beneath it and turn your hand all around until it is dislodged.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; for if it is broken, it will be difficult to raise it and may cause harm to the patient because of this injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when that entire cord is dislodged, place a dressing over the wound soaked in wine and olive oil, both red and white, and heal it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the wound is contracted with tortuosity in which there is adhesion at the sides, and it is not straight as we have said, you must cut it all along the side of the tortuosity and the places of adhesion, and suspend it with scissors until you raise it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Be careful to make your incision without cutting the vein and damaging it, for it will be difficult to raise it, and use your judgment in this matter.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the incision that is performed on a contracted vein:
Forma de unci orp:	The form of a lion's claw:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not appropriate to apply it like a nail or of sharp extremity so as not to harm the vein; and it is of large flexibility, because if it were subtle, it would cut the vein due to its subtlety; having excessive thickness like we said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Translation: Extraction of leg vein. (Meaning: Removal of a vein from the leg.)
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the knees, such as in the Egyptian lands in the Arabian deserts and in the Indian lands with little vegetation and where there is no grass or herbs.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is also generated in other parts of the body other than the knees.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its formation is due to corruption, which comes from the bowels such as venom that escapes inside the body and snakes, worms, scabies and worms multiplying between the bowels and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the onset of this condition is the swelling of the knee, which becomes extremely inflamed; and place your hand over it, as it begins to emit a vein similar in appearance to a plant from the site of that inflammation.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	When the fetus appears at the end, it is necessary to cover it with a lead weight of a pound or two and leave it suspended from the bed.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And whenever any signs of that condition appear outside, cover it with lead and secure it in place.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it persists, you should make an incision there and cover the remaining part; do not incise that which is visible outside, as incising it will cause contraction, entering the flesh and causing abscesses, pus, and a bad ulcer at the site.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it must be treated gently and extracted slowly, until it is completely expelled from the body without any remaining cause within the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, it has been expelled in some men who are of the length of five palms (approximately 18 inches) and I have heard that one as long as twenty palms has also been expelled.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during treatment, insert the lance into its depth and perforate it lengthwise with the body, until all that is in the material is evacuated, and administer corruption of the site for several days with medicines; and care for it as you would treat abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	This vein sometimes stops growing, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and it often causes abscesses, and is extracted from each abscess separately.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	Therefore, treat it as previously described and with what has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	On incision of worms generated under the skin, it is called bovine illness (cattle sickness).
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is known in some lands as "bovine disease" because it often invades cattle and is a rare worm that develops between the bowels and flesh, moves throughout the body, and eventually breaks through the skin, displaying symptoms in different parts of the body until the bowel is ruptured and it comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	The generation of this condition is due to the corruption of certain humors such as worms, snakes, larvae, and tapeworms in the abdomen.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared because of its malicious nature, as when it moves through the body and reaches the head, it can cause a severe cough, enter the brain, and destroy it, causing numerous symptoms in various parts of the body.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Therefore, when you want to cure and remove it, do not proceed if its movement and appearance have not been observed, and it is necessary to strengthen the area above and below it and apply constant pressure, and then press firmly and dry the affected area before extracting it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is incised in the flesh but not completely penetrated, then you pause cauterizing fire upon that spot, and the main fear is corruption of the wound by which the site is also corrupted as has been said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If it comes to the head of the nose, you apply pressure above the eyebrow with strong tightening and wipe it, and pull it out; be sure that the patient uses purgatives for their body and medications that evacuate putrid humors, and keep away from foods causing putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	From incision to the pain of the nose.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called "nafir" in our land, and it is pain that occurs in some members, and it is transmitted from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen it according to what I advised.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You were called to a sick woman in a village, and you found her arm, and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and since it was cut open for an hour, I saw that inflammation swell as if worms were crawling towards this, but less noticeably than blood flowing from place to place. Like silver flowing from one place to another.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then the pain moved to that spot and settled in the muscle, and here it stayed for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	It went back into the other body towards the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And I advise you to rotate the body all around as I saw; and it was very marveled at by the change and the speed of the member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	You have already seen such cases in the most serious wounds according to that method, but I have also seen some who had pain transmitted from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But not as in the woman's case.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it was that kind of case because the woman was old, with dry bodies and exposed veins, and in this case, it appeared to me as a kind of wind transmitted by sensation.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this treatment in those who are delicate and have bodies with soft veins weakened.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	As you want the healing of it, and the patient feels that pain, do not press on the wound as has been said, but instead apply pressure gently and wipe it until the constriction subsides, and cauterize the spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it in your wounds, then you cure it by purging the body and expelling wind, and administer pills made of figs and fig-tree leaves and similar remedies.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of sutures.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sutures are of various types according to their species and the parts of the body where they are located, because of their diversity, some have large points, small ones, concave ones, dull ones, solid ones; some have three corners, those that have tongues, and those called stitches.
