And therefore, when it is seen in any of these cases and especially if it is during the third or middle of the month, then command ventosication to be performed after more than two or three hours have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	In addition to ventosication of the neck, it is also that when it causes gravity in the head and what happens is that it sinks into the eyes; but it is necessary that this be accompanied by evacuation of the entire body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	This ventosication is in the location of lancing of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not appropriate to use it for complete purge or in cases of catarrh, as this causes great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	Therefore, it is not necessary to use it on the elderly or those with cold heads (diseases).
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But in the case of continuous bleeding on that spot, it is necessary to command the ventosicator to pause his hand a little at the opening, fearing the generation of forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventosication of the axilla is in the location of lancing of the vein of the arm and the basilica: and this causes asthma, constriction of the chest and splitting of the costal cartilage, cough, and repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	It is necessary to prick the axillary ventosication slightly, as if it is left undone, it generates weakness in the chest and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	The ventosication of alhagdahan causes accidental pains in the head and optic neuritis, emigration (spreading), inflammation, and pain in the roots of the teeth; it is in the location of lancing of the basilica vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	It is necessary to command the ventosicator not to press his hand during incision so as not to pierce the artery and cause a flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	Ventosication behind the mouth causes alcohol in the mouth and corruption of the gums, and is similar to oral diseases that are located in the location of lancing of the alveolar vein on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the ventosication made with two spatulas causes catarrh of the head (croup), which is caused by accumulation of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	In addition, the ventosication of both armpits causes lancing of three veins, namely the basilica, femoral, and cephalic, as it draws blood from all those small vessels that are in the flesh, and those small veins from other larger veins before reaching the attraction to the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	Command the ventosicator not to proceed with incision as the area is exposed with flesh, and there are nerves and arteries below it.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	This is a ventosication on the anus and causes hemorrhoids of the rectum and ulcers below it.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	It is necessary to command the ventosicator that it be a large ventosication, and that it be on an area requiring strong incision; and strong cuts are needed for subtle ventosications and it should be incised with incision.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But the small ventosications in the chest cause blood to be drawn from the entire body, and cause old pains of coughs and malaise, as well as of the bladder; they provoke menstruation, and cause abscesses and edema; and they are located for lancing of two subclavian veins and the axillary.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	The body as a whole weakens and causes fainting in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	From the hernias, the remedy is similar to the remedy for two-sided hernias.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	The quality of the position of hernias is to place the hernia at first on a cushion and suck it with early suction, and not to prolong the position of hernias, but rather to let them rest lightly, and keep them constantly, and that the humors come to the area by chance.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	Do not stop repeating it and continue until you see the place redden and swell and that the pus appears from the wound.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Then you will cut and repeat the suction little by little, and be careful in the placement of the patient's body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	However, for a man with tender skin of rare pores, you must cut only once and not repeatedly, so as not to ulcerate the area.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	Command the hernia surgeon to enlarge the incision and make a small wound, and take care to facilitate the suction.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the pus becomes thick, then you must cut twice, as in the first cutting it opens the passage for fine drainage and for the liquid to flow out.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, there is a more thorough investigation of the removal of thick pus.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the pus is very foul-smelling, then a third cutting should be made to achieve the final result.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Lastly, when we want to extract the pus little by little or in small amounts, it is enough for us with one cutting.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a large amount of pus, we must cut with many cuts; and if we know that the pus is thick, then it is necessary to cut with a deeper incision.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the depth of incision in the term "cutting" only refers to the stitching.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the stitching is thick, hard, dark, and its pores are narrow, then the places of hernias should be treated more gently, more open, resolved; if it is in summer, as with aloe oil or violet oil, or olive oil from double-pressed olives, or oil from camomile seeds, or similar substances; and if it is in winter, use narce oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or oil of pus and similar substances.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	If the excess is thick, then use oil of wormwood, balm of Gilead, aloe oil, or aniseed oil, and similar substances.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the hernia surgeon has wide pores of tender skin, then it is necessary to prohibit oil, and instead, wash the places of hernias with warm water or boiling water from solanum, camomile flowers, mustard, or similar substances.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for one whose pus is of much moisture, wash the hernias with vinegar or myrtle and sumac water, similar to these substances.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for one whose excesses are thick, wash the hernias with old vinegar, or water of mustard that is greater than camomile, or decoction of aniseed, or chamomile, and similar substances.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	It is necessary to keep the hernia covered before washing; having it washed immediately after washing for one or two hours, and sleeping near the hernia.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it necessary to do so that a person with hernia is bled before the herniotomy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	You must first consider: if the hernia surgeon or one who is to bleed is cold and has sharp blood and inflammation, then you must take cooling agents, as with peppermint, endive leaves, vinegar, and lettuce, and similar substances.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their food such as poultry, game birds, foods seasoned with acids, and similar substances.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for one whose complexion is cold, take almond syrup or anise seed syrup, sumac, and a moderately fragrant oil between November and Easter; and it should be advised to drink sparingly and eat little, pause the poultry and game birds, fish, and small birds and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of herniotomy and bleeding, the drink should be more than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	It is necessary to give some men tarragon extract or musk medicine (musk oil or aloeswood) in advance of the herniotomy or bleeding, or near it, so that the main limbs are comforted and the blood is made thin; and it is not necessary to give that scalding.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	However, hernias that are not incised are hernias that are stopped in the liver, on the spleen and on the navel, in the inguinal areas, and in the area of the anus, because these members cannot be incised on them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And this is not desired for them but rather the attraction of blood from a member, as stopping a hernia on the breast in anemia of blood from the nose or mouth; and it is used to dissolve cold and thickened blood in a member, as stopping on the stomach and navel; because this dilates the member and heats it up and reduces the pain that resolves the hernia.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And when it is necessary for the bladder or stone to be removed when it happens in their oblation or passage, because by its strong attraction, it draws the bladder and expels the stone from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly, when it is necessary for the liver and spleen to be removed because of their imprisonment in that area.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These evacuations are administered with juice alone, and some are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some of these evacuations are administered full of tepid water in the case of spleen diseases.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	This is because the evacuation should be filled and as large as possible, which is tepid water alone or tepid water with appropriate herbs added to it.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	The method of evacuation with fire: the diameter of the orifice should be two fingers' width, according to how we have formed it; and the depth of the wound should be as wide as that, the size of the probe should be as large as a thumb; and in its length, in the area around it, it should be as wide as that, the incision should be small according to the size of an awl that fits inside it.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of ivy or lemon leaves, with thick edges, lion's tooth, and clean for it not to hurt the member when placed on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in its middle, a crossbar of ivy or iron, where the candle is placed with fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this evacuation should be much larger than the one we have recommended; and it should be smaller according to the disease and the state of the person who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the evacuations for children and women are different from those for young men and large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	The quality of performing this evacuation with fire on the member is that it should extend the skin with a sufficient amount of wood and a little candle wax, and place it on the middle of the crossbar in the middle of the opening, so that the fire is lit around the edges to prevent burning the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And it should be placed on the patient's member, and the aforementioned candle is to be placed on the incision that we have mentioned, until when we have the evacuations and do not require the candle and the steam rises over that incision, then the evacuation will quickly dissolve.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	Use fire according to its method, and repeat it if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	When performing an evacuation for pleurisy disease, with water, in which there is no crossbar or incision, and it should not be administered unless it is filled with water, and placed on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its method: The larger the evacuation, the better it is because it can receive more water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Capital 75.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguisuga is not administered in any member except in members where the position of evacuations is not possible due to their small size, such as lips and similar, or in a member denuded of flesh, such as the nose and its similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those is to find sanguisuga in the pure waters of stone quarries.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And they should be washed daily and at night in pure water until they are clean, and no cause remains in their belly; and they should be evacuated at the beginning with flebotomy and evacuations; and they should rub the patient's member before it becomes dark; and they should be placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled and ready.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to get juice from the place of evacuation, it is more useful in addition.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And otherwise, wash the place with vinegar and add salt water, rub and squeeze it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the body's bleeding lasts for a long time because of sanguisuga, and it is exuded, then place a cloth dipped in cold water on it, and leave it until the discharge stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	If the bleeding is excessive, sprinkle vitriol triturated powder or similar stiptics on it, until the bleeding is stopped; or place leeks cooked in boiling water, and leave them until they adhere to the area, and let the bleeding stop.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, repeat the administration of sanguisuga when it is possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the administration of sanguisuga is prohibited for suspension, then rub the place with fresh blood or insert an awl into the area until it bleeds; and place them on it, because they immediately stick to the blood when they feel it.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall, sprinkle a little powdered allium (onion) or salt or ashes on them and shake them immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	In the same way begins the procedure for the third division: recovery.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is about some procedures necessary in the art of medicine; and it concerns the recovery from fractures and dislocation accidents in bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, understand that the foolish doctors and common people and those who do not care about the books of the Ancients or read a single letter from them boast about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason this method of the wise men in our land is kept secret; and I have not forgotten it at any time; but I have not put it into practice before a long study of the books of the Ancients and understanding of them, until I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	Approach with the intention of experimenting and studying throughout one's lifetime.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	You have already described in this chapter everything that contains the main science and on which much experiment has been conducted; therefore, here I will abbreviate it for you and free you from the burden of lengthy explanation; I will abridge it in the end of abridgement; and at the end of declaration, I will show it; I will form many forms of the instruments that are administered in this, as is done by addition of declaration, such as I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collection from the causes of bone fractures, from which a premise is necessary before we begin the recalling of fractured limbs and various types of each.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, I shall state in the prologue of this chapter the summation of the argument; and the chapters to which the craftsmen are introduced and stand at attention regarding the truth of these matters; it is for you and those who wish to learn or quickly understand this noble art of yours.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And I say that when an accident occurs such as a fracture or dislocation or twist or breakage, it is necessary at the beginning to perform fleubotomy or allaying of that member, or whatever else, unless there is any prohibiting cause, such as weakness of strength, or if that member is in motion, or old age, or time of intense heat, or of intense cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And let it be content with a diet of cooling herbs and bird meats such as thrush and partridge; and prohibit heavy meats and filling with food or any food that fills the veins with blood, until you are assured of cauterizing an abscess, and if you do not fear effusion of matter in the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their initial regimen with which they are accustomed to follow.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, it is necessary that the patient be fed with nutritious foods of thick and heavy consistency and those which have viscosity, such as foods made from cooked wheat and water, rice, peas, beans, cow's stomach, hog's flesh, fresh meat, thick vegetables, and similar foods; and with this regimen, coagulation of the fracture is performed more easily and quickly.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones shattered in men who are young and those who are old and weak cannot be continued or consolidated according to their nature by the drying out of their members due to disease.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And these bones are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time by the drying out of those members, and these bones that are in the latter stages of growth, such as a child's bones, are consolidated and continued.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature also adjusts and mends in every part of the broken bone some cause similar to a splint in which swelling occurs that adheres to it until it is consolidated and fixed together, until the time of hardness and firmness arrives, such as fire at the beginning, until any prohibiting cause does not interfere with its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to stop the patient's diet, a diet that has weight and viscosity and thickness, as I have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	The diversity of fracture varies according to the diversity of the member.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the members, for a fracture in the thigh bone is different from a fracture in the head bone; and a fracture in the foot bone is different from a fracture in the arm bone; and similarly, all other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I will continue with the recalling of every type of fracture, described in its own chapter separately.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	The diversity of fractures is as follows:
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	The sentence means: "There are various types of bone fractures in their causes; one is the arched fracture, which occurs in the stars (stellas); and some are fractured according to the length of the bone: and those of the shinbone and splinter fractures, both occurring and not occurring, such as a fracture prepared for writing, and is a fracture with a wound and disruption in the head, and is a fissured small fracture."
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	"In every type of fracture, there is pain or torment peculiar to its restoration according to the recall of its separate details in their respective places."
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	"Sign of a bone fracture."
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	"And by that is recognized a bone fracture: its twisted state, and the prominence and awareness of it to the sensation, and only when you press it with your hand."
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	"Therefore, if there is no apparent twisted state or it does not produce pain when touched with movement and the patient does not feel great pain, then it is not here a fracture."
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	"It is possible that there may be a twisted state or a small fissure, in which case you must press it with your hand and compress it entirely; pause over the location of the medicine whose remedy comes to mind at that moment that suits the location; and apply tightness through subtle constraint."
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	"And you should know that the location which is arched and not split in two or something that does not occur in the shinbone, such as complete detachment of its entire part, then it is necessary to start from your time on the correction of it having applied a post-operative cauterization."
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	"And if there has been post-operative cauterization, then you should leave it for several days until the cauterization ceases; and apply ointment to it in whatever way that suits your discretion."
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	"And you should know that the restoration and piercing of a fracture is easier than in the bone where such a shinbone fracture occurs."
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	"And strengthen it according to the recall of it."
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	"But if it is a shinbone fracture, then it is necessary to extend this broken limb from two parts, whether the arm or the leg; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two ropes or with one rope and your hand."
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	"And position yourself in such a way as to place the limb where it is extended according to its natural figure, while the fractured parts are being extended, you should then make an effort to return those additions with discretion and in whatever way you can manage."
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	"And be careful not to injure the patient through your action or cause harm; and proceed according to your strength that you apply one bone with another in the best ways possible."
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	"And it is necessary that at this time you press with your hand, and if there is any other cause here, correct it and guide it according to the amount of your power."
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	"And avoid excessive extension and compression, as foolish doctors often cause post-operative cauterization or cause contraction in the limb as we have seen through their actions."
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	"And connect, align, perform proper operation and constrain that limb, rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and make him aware not to move it at the time of his vigils and sleep, observe its rotation and agitation, and take care of all its movements with your entire power; and wait for the position of the limb to be in a position that ensures pain, which cause is because when he feels pain in the position of the injured or fractured limb; then it is necessary to change that position to another position where there is no pain; and ensure that the position of it is straight and aligned so that the limb does not twist as it is being restored."
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	"And the quality of the constraint of a fractured and immobilized limb is that which I recommend, because you should know that fractured limbs are diverse in their size, shape, and nature."
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	"And for those that are small such as the arm and the hand and similar ones, it is necessary that the wrapping be made of thin fabric."
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	"But for those that are large such as the thigh or leg, it is necessary that the wrapping be broad and hard, because a firm binding connects the large limb and strengthens it throughout with constraint, in this way that nothing enters into it."
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	"And begin with your evacuation of alignment, pause appropriately according to the situation, over the location of the fracture with three or four wrappings depending on the limb; and strengthen your hand a little with the binding."
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	"And beware of that at the upper end of the location of the fracture, and strengthen less than you have tightened the area of the fracture."
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	"And extend yourself and the wrapping at the location of the fracture a little, and loosen the tightness gradually until you take a large portion of it."
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	"And take another bandage and wrap it over the fractured area with the previous wrapping, and wrap the ends at the lower end of the fracture; and your action is in tightening the bandage and loosening it according to what you have said in the first bandage."
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And place a cushion between the swellings of the thigh bone or the lion's skin cloth that is wrapped around the tortuous nature of the fracture, if there is tortuosity in it; but if not, do not cause any pressure on it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And place a cushion over the other wound, and wrap it with appropriate bandages immediately if there is no inflammation or abscess at that location, and then press on the one where the abscess is and heal the inflammation; leave it for some days; and afterwards press firmly on the wounds.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	The needles should be made of linen thread and well-crafted; or of wood; or of palm fronds; and their size should be according to this shape and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the stitch that is placed over the fracture should be thicker and narrower than the other stitches, and the length of the thread according to what is appropriate for the limb in size and shape; and press firmly on the stitches with another bandage according to your primary binding; and place it above with a cloth properly tied as we have said about binding, and it should be your binding according to the location of the fracture more, and the longer it is away from the fracture, the less the binding.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the threads be of medium thickness and subtlety, and made of flax; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen by the work of some foolish people using thick ropes instead of threads in binding, and this is a great error, because the binding will not be equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And very thin threads are not suitable because you will not be able to achieve binding with them, and it is necessary that there be a space of one finger width between each stitch.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	If the patient is pricked by the ends of the stitches near the binding in those places, then stop immediately and wrap them with lion skin or woolen cloth before it causes injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is accompanied by an abscess, and there is a rupture in the bandage, and I will come back to remember it in that chapter according to its specificity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that the entire broken member is not to be stitched on the first day; this is because a large limb does not require stitching immediately but rather waits for 5 or 7 days, according to your certainty of the occurrence of an abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the method of plasters used by the ancients to restore fractures, dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Common plaster method for the restoration of fractures, suitable for complex cases and more commonly used for women and children, because it is applied to what does not require warmth or friction; take powder from milling, and this is the marrow of the flour that comes out when grinding the wheat in the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	Mix it in this way if possible, otherwise sieve it with egg whites, and prepare the paste without being too thick or too thin, and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method for treating dislocated and twisted fractures: a recipe of asafetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, migrax (wild marjoram), which is a mixture of one pound of each ingredient; myrrh, aloe, and allochil (a type of resin) in half a pound each. They are crushed and sieved, then mixed with aloe water or egg white if the patient's complexion is scaly. Use this ointment because it has good composition and helps heal broken bones gently, and is suitable for most men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for treating dislocated or twisted fractures: a recipe of wild marjoram and white alum in equal parts, one pound each; myrrh and aloe in half a pound each. Acacia is six pounds, Armenian bole is two pounds.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Mix all of these ingredients in a mortar with powdered charcoal and sieve them, then prepare a compress with water or egg white and administer it.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Apply a poultice to joints and bones separated from their places, relieve pain in those areas and swelling or fractures: take wool soaked in vinegar and oil of cedar, squeeze it and place it on the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	Do not expect this poultice to have restorative properties, but rather to promote drainage and relieve pain directly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of poultice for fractured bones: take leaves of fig tree and leaves of opium poppy; grind everything together to make a poultice from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A shortened method of poultice for fractured bones and the resolution of abscesses: grind a mixture of althea, camomile flowers, violets, oats and all other ingredients. Grind all ingredients in vinegar if the limb is not scalded (burned).
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scalded, then compress it with a cold water of colander or the same water (used for washing).
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of poultice for hard abscess that requires the resolution of the limb: grind a mixture of althea and its seeds, balm of Gilead, melilot, marjoram, violets, camomile, everything together and compress it with water of willow bark or sweet water or vinegar, depending on the quality of the limb and the relaxation of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates does not specify in his book that a poultice should be placed on a broken limb for its recovery, but rather a resinous mixture of wax and oil, without any other cause; he recommends it to be medium between coarseness and fineness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	In Gaul it is seen that poultices are placed on a broken limb for its recovery and the causes in which there is dryness with little heat such as myrrh, juniper, similar to those we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A poultice that relieves injury and pain: grind meadowsweet, hops, shaved human skin or pen of goose feathers, althea, salt and mix everything together; sieve it and compress it to make a poultice.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount that should remain for the wound to heal and be discharged depends on whether there is pain or inflammation or if the bone is broken out of its place, in such a case you should not undress it for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is strong pain or inflammation at the location, you should remove it at that time and apply a poultice to it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a cloth and sea sponge soaked in lemon juice, immerse it in warm water, and with that wash the affected area until the inflammation and pain cease; let the limb rest for an hour; then apply a compress made of wool soaked in vinegar and oil or scented oil on it, for one night until you are sure the abscess has drained, and that the inflammation of the limb is relieved, and the pain is gone.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And apply a gentle and small pressure to the affected area, without straining it at first, and gradually make it smaller until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	If the abscess and redness, pain, inflammation, and all symptoms have been healed, and no longer need poultices or pressure, then you should proceed as you did at the beginning.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause of those mentioned above affects the limb, you should not undress it for three or four days or five or six days. And after certain periods of time (20 days according to your judgment based on the undressing of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and the skin begins to heal over it).
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And you should tighten the bandage more than your initial one and adjust the swelling of the patient's food supply as required, according to the previous reminder.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you see the location of the fracture already dried and extended more than necessary, then you know that nourishment is prohibited from reaching it; therefore, wrap it with hot, boiling water continuously for three days, relax the constriction a little, and through this operation, allow nourishment to flow to the limb, and it will heal lightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what the foolish restorers of a limb's fracture do later when it is not restored at first, as necessary, and it is restored according to tortuosity, is error according to their operation, and there is great fear, and if it were correct they would have enlarged the Ancients in their books and would have acted accordingly.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone among them do that, so it is reasonable that it should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter on fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are multiple, and the shapes of them are various, and the causes are distinct, for some fracture is caused by a blow with a sharp object that penetrates the whole bone, which is then broken, as happens in the leg, and this type of fracture is called sciatic; or the sharp object cuts into one part of the bone and cuts through the flesh but does not penetrate to the other side; and this type of fracture is called absolute levation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	The wound from these two types of fractures can be large or small, and the fracture can be concave or convex; the cause of it is striking with heavy objects or falling on stones, and so forth.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	This fracture can either penetrate the subcutaneous tissue (pannicol), which is located just below the bone, or it can occur on the surface of the bone, and the wound from these two types of fractures can be large or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of the fracture that is reduced in the bone, in the subtlety of the hair follicle, small, and for this reason, this type of fracture is called capillary fracture.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	The fracture that is caused by falling or striking with stones, and similar occurrences, causes one layer of the bone to separate from its edges, and it occurs in the concave area, such as when it happens to the vertebrae when they are struck and separated at their edges.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	Moreover, this is done in bones that are soft, such as in the spines of children.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures have similar symptoms, such as separated bones.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And you will come with remedy for all in their place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	I will discern all kinds of fracture through examination and by testing for them and the removal of corrupt flesh that is over them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	A capillary fracture is recognized by being uncovered on the bone, and it is scraped off, and it turns white when tested, for a fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fracture, it is first necessary to consider the conditions of the patient, and afterwards if you see signs that indicate fear, such as vomiting of bile, extension, loss of consciousness, abscesses in the throat, fainting, acute fever, inflammation or redness of the eyes, and similar signs in the greater dispositions, one doubts that it is healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if there are no unusual signs, you hope for health, then you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is that if it has come to you in the beginning like a fracture and that is during winter days, then you must remove the bone splint no later than the twelfth day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	If it is during summer days, then you must remove the bone splint no later than the seventh day, because if the bone remains untreated for too long, it may rot due to the fat, and the signs that I mentioned before may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has reached the fat covering the brain, and it is fragmented into small parts and sticky, then you must pack the fractured area with compressed material according to my recommendation.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you raise the head of the patient with fracture, and uncover the bone according to your custom and as possible according to the shape of the injury, and it should be comfortable for the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it occurs to you, you must examine the bone, search for bleeding or an abscess, and then oppose yourself with what is necessary, which is to place damp cloths soaked in wine and olive oil over the injury, and allow the wound to rest until the abscess is relieved, and make sure that the bleeding has stopped; and begin with the circumcision of the bone and excision of it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two ways of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	The first method is that you insert the bone splint with a narrow incision tool of this kind: And place another incision tool of slightly greater size on it; and this is its shape:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Place the wider incision tool on top of the narrow one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And it is necessary for you to have a number of incision tools of different sizes, some larger than others, and some shorter than the others and ending in sharp points, and made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	Use them with ease when striking the incision tool to avoid hitting the head and damaging it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	If the bone is hard and strong, then you must perforate around it before applying the incision tools with levers, which are called non-penetrating levers.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	They are not called that because the lever does not reach the end of the bone, so at the lever's tip is rounded or edge on top of the sharp head of it, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	It is appropriate for you to take a large number of these levers, the quantity of which should be according to the thickness of each bone, until it reaches the end of every part of the skull, the sharpness of which may vary in length and width according to the thickness of the bone.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	This is the shape of three types of levers: The purpose of perforating around the broken bone is to place the lever on the bone and rotate it with your hands until you feel that the bone has been penetrated; and then move the lever to another location, and place it where the amount of thickness of the rod or environment is maximum.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And insert the incision tools between each crack in the bone and use the smallest one that you can on it until you have cut through the bone or with your hand or some other means using various tools such as tweezers and pliers, which you will prepare for this purpose.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And it is necessary that you take care that the incision tool does not touch any nerve.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	Therefore, when you perforate the bone, if it is continuous with the nerve, you should separate it from the nerve and extract it, and then cut and file away the sharp edges of the bone with another tool similar to an incision tool but much thinner.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any small fragments or splinters of bones remain, you should take care of them with the tools that are necessary for you; and then treat the wound with linen and ointment as I have said before.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	The other method is light and free of fear, which is known as Guillaume's operation and is highly praised; and this is its explanation: It is necessary for you at the beginning to begin discovering the fracture of the bone in the place where it is most obvious and visible until when you have found that fragment and stopped at its end, the tip of the following incision tool should be placed gently and slowly over it. The shape of the incision tool is as follows:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	The first sharp incision is made along two sides advancing in length, as sometimes occurs; the second rounded incision should be adjusted at the hipbone with the edge of the first sharp incision in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	Then strike with the blunt side of the incision tool into a small depression that cuts through all the bone with ease as it rotates, and you must be assured that no panic will occur in the event that you fear something might happen in any way; if the healer was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them, certainly, he would be asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	If any cause of panic remains attached to the bone of the incision, you will make an incision with the rounded edge of the incision tool in that location of the bone, and it will be delivered easily, since it is delivered from there without harm or fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	If the bone fracture does not penetrate into the incision, and what is abscessed or remains from the bone is its surface, and it retains roughness and subtle fissures, then you must smooth that roughness and remove those fissures with fine razors that you have prepared in various quantities so that it is possible for you to administer them in all places the most suitable and the most correct according to where your operation goes wrong with the broken bone and the shape of it.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	You must administer the razor with which you smooth the bone at first from the side of those razors, and then use it near the subtle part of it, and do not cease to do so continuously until you reach administering the pus and all the subtle parts of them.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	In each of the other small and subtle fractures, you must administer care according to what you lost during correction.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	It is because not all those who have studied in that art are equally skilled.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And we write about what they have demonstrated in large fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	If the incision is rectangular when you smooth the bone, then you must take linen cloth according to the size of the wound and immerse it in warm oil, and place it over the wound; and take another linen cloth folded or tripled and immerse it in vinegar and oil, and place it on top of the first cloth and perform a light massage on the pus that you can without injuring the bone; and apply ointment to it, but do not press it too much, only as much as the wound requires.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	Leave that with this care for a day or two until you are sure of cauterization; then loosen it and administer medicines with which excessive dryness is superfluous, such as linseed oil, flour of rye, powder of asafoetida and aristolochia, and similar to these.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	You should make powder of these medicines that is pulverized over the wound, such as drying ones; and in general, administer all medicine of the property of which is that it absorbs but does not burn.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Be careful that the wound in your care is clean; do not let it get infected with any filth or anything else; nor leave virulence there; because when it is placed on the skull of the brain, it corrupts it and poisons it, causing harm to the patient with a wicked malignant illness.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	If it happens on the skull of the head, when the bone is corrected and treatment is applied to it, and becomes darker in its surface; then consider if the accidents that we have said happen to the patient, you will know that they are harmful without any doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If it does not get darker due to the medicine that is applied on it, but rather due to the nature of the medicine, then you must take honey and warm oil in three parts. And with that linen cloth, place it on the skull; and care for it with the spices of healing until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken into two parts together, but rather one of those parts is elevated above the other, because there are two bones in it; and the fracture does not occur in one of them, but rather it bends, twists, and swells.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	If the bone is broken in one of its two divisions, then it is necessary that you insert your little finger into the nose and guide the fracture within with your other finger, and apply pressure from outside, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	Do this for ease, but be careful not to harm the patient due to your treatment.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	If the fracture is in the upper part of the nose and the finger does not reach it, then you must align the extremity of the ray where there is a small swelling.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	If the fracture is in two places, then you should make an approximation (of what was done).
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	Cure the patient in the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then return the wound to rest for seven or ten days under a cauterized dressing.
