E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	When this method of treatment reduces the end of the muscle when it is separated from its location.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is that it is dislocated from the biceps to the opposite side.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated above the muscle, and this is rarely done; it is not dislocated behind the shoulder; nor is it dislocated in front of the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	Moreover, it is dislocated and out of the sides on the opposite side of the biceps, and moreover in those with less flesh it is easily dislocated; but in those with thicker flesh, it comes out with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And a strong blow or fall often happens to some men, and the muscle of that man is separated from the cauterized abscess, and it is dressed with what has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Therefore, you must find out what was done to him, and then proceed with the treatment of it.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	The dislocation of it is known when it is on the opposite side from the biceps; therefore distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the undislocated one, for you will find clear differences among them; and you feel the concavity at the head of the muscle in this way like an hour-glass, and on the biceps side of the muscle you should touch the head of the muscle in such a way that it is like an hour-glass, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his elbow, nor can he move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated on the foot or below, you should find clear tactile differences and do not hide them.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And from this dislocation an easy reduction is made when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	The reduction of it is that the minister raises the hand above it, and places his thumbs below the biceps of it, and raises the joint with strength toward its location, and the minister raises the hand and extends it; and he places it below as it returns easily.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return by what we have said, and is from the beginning that the dislocation occurred, many days later you must bathe the patient in hot water and administer a plaster that softens and liniments like if it were a chest wound of aloe, fenugreek, and marshmallow in water, and it should be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Then the patient should be placed on his back and positioned below the biceps of it is to wait for a linen that is between looseness and tightness, and then the doctor places his foot on the shoulder, and lifts the head of the muscle with force, and draws the hand of the patient so that it does not move toward the opposite side, and another minister holds the head of the patient, who must not move to the opposite side, because it will soon return to its location.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce it in this way: it is that you bring a man who is longer than the patient and stands on the side of him, and places his muscle below the biceps of the patient and elevates the biceps of him to the shoulders until the patient is suspended in the air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the opposite side of his stomach.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is light, you must have something suspended to weigh him down, so that the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in another way: it is that a long pole with its head rounded like a mortar pestle, neither thick nor thin, is placed on the ground, and positioned below the patient; then you stand on top of the pole fabric, and the patient stands according to the length of the pole, and his hand should be extended toward the opposite side, and the other part should be extended with strength, because the joint will return to its location quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction of it is difficult due to all the reasons we have said, then use this treatment: it is that you take a pole whose length is two forearms and its width four fingers, and its thickness is reduced in the proximal part of the biceps according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place leather strips around the rounded head so that the pole does not hurt the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	Position the biceps of the patient below and extend the arm or shoulder over the pole to the opposite side, and tie the pole to the support and the arm and the end of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Position the arm on a ladder of steps according to its width, and extend the hand to the opposite side, and the other part should be suspended from the other part, because the joint will soon join together.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the incision of him is completed in any way that is possible for you, then you must stop pressing on the wound with a lamb's wool pad of appropriate size; and place a plaster prepared from powdered mint leaves and honey over the muscle, so it is rolled up, and press down on the wound with a suitable constrictor; and let the dressing be rolled over the plaster, and his hand should be connected to his neck, and let it rest, and his hand should not be moved for 12 days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And it is necessary that the wound of the patient be stopped up little by little until the member is comforted because it is easier for healing to occur there.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	Then apply more dressing to the wound or exercise movement on it, so if it remains closed and does not become soft, then it is healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated by moisture that occurs in it or for another reason, then in such a case, it is necessary to administer three cauteries as previously stated in the chapter on cauterization.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all of this is done and the dressing is removed after seven days and the joint is not closed, and the plaster and bandage are reduced upon it a little, and it remains unclosed and swollen and that arm cannot be raised to the upper parts, then you know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, have become injured or stretched out or softened, and you should know that the joint will never be properly set in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	In the case of the dislocation mentioned above, you must apply pressure to the foot and the breast or the upper parts behind it, the reduction is done with a push and extension until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And another bandage should be applied to that one, and take care of it until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if there is delay in the healing of the member or gravity in its movement, then the patient should bathe it frequently until that gravity is relieved and it returns to its natural state.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the treatment of shoulder dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You should know that the joint of the shoulder is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated on all sides, especially in front and behind, and the dislocation of it is not hidden from you because it is evidently displaced by either the elbow or the touch, depending on the shape of the dislocation, and when you adjust the dislocated shoulder according to the arm, that is clearly stated to you, for the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm nor touch its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And you must quickly reduce the dislocation in front so that it reaches a blister of cautery, because if it gets to a blister of cautery, the reduction is difficult and recovery from it is not easy; and especially when it is at the rear parts, for all other types of dislocations are worse than this one and more painful, and many wounds occur in the process, which can lead to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	The restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that his hand should be extended with two others, and the arm should be expanded, and the hands of the doctor are above the shoulder and below it, and he pushes the joint with the thumbs of his hands together, or with the flat part of his palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is at the front parts, then it returns by bending the arm with its hand until it strikes the shoulder with the flat part of the palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not yield to reduction, then you administer vigorous extension and strong movement.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers should extend the arm, and have another two ministers to ensure that there is no excessive extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Approach should be to roll up the entire arm, as it is wrapped in long folded cloth around it, or bound.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the doctor touches the joint with his hand, anoint it with some oil so that this may help in the lubrication of the joint and facilitate its movement; then press the joint firmly until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	Approach the reduction of it (the hernia) requires that pressure be applied on the plaster where there is swelling and protrusion with honey albumen, and it should be drawn out by means of a strong bandage descent; and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and it should be left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Approach should be to loosen it (the bandage); and since the joint has been formed in its place, you should then loosen the bandage from there.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	If the joint is not strong, then you should repeatedly apply the plaster and bandage to it, and leave it for some days until it is drawn out; then approach should be to loosen it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if there is danger of gravitation during the reduction of the joint, and its position is in movement, you should administer humectation in bath and subtle friction, and compression, until it is relieved; or press on the dislocated joint, which is a matter of heavy grease; then tie it, and leave it on the bone for a day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	Approach should be to place it (the dislocated joint) back in its place, and immerse it in bath; when it swells, you should then rub the joint gently with friction, and approach repeatedly on the dislocated joint, which is a matter of round motion, once, twice, and three times.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has now reached the intestine internally through bathing, and it needs to stop spreading.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	If you wish, press on the warm and moist cowhide gash with a rod and press firmly on it; do this several times, for it is moist and helps to reduce it to its position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter XXVIII.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the treatment of dislocation of shoulder, which is the joint between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	The shoulder of the hand sometimes dislocates, and the reduction of the dislocation is easy, but the opposite is true for other joints; however, it is necessary to be quick in reducing it at the time when it is dislocated, before the location is disrupted or there is a cautionary warning of disruption.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	The reduction of the dislocation is that you place the joint of the patient's hand on a table and extend their arm, and then place your hand or palm over the proximity of the joint and press it firmly until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	However, it should be considered if the palm has already been placed on the belly of the hand; in this case, you should extend and reduce the patient's fingers, and if the dislocation is precedent (meaning before), then the position of the hand should be intrinsically placed on the table, so that the doctor's hand fits over the proximity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns quickly, that is good; but if not, you should press it firmly with plaster waiting for the dislocation to occur, and do not repeat it, as it can cause pain or be impossible to reduce it unless days have passed.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	However, the joint should be treated according to its curvature; and do not notice any pain in the patient, but rather soften the hand and do not make it stronger because the nerves may be broken or crushed; then understand that the nerves are crushed or fractured, and then do not engage in it unless it is strong enough with cautery for the treatment of the fracture and confer some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	When the shoulder is returned, you should press on the plaster that has been recommended and leave it and strengthen it for 5 days; then approach should be to loosen it and leave the arm of the patient to rest and exercise.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the movement of it is stopped and there is danger in it, you should gently massage it with hot water and friction for several times until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter XXIX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the treatment of dislocation of fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Fingers are sometimes dislocated in various places.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	When a finger of these is dislocated at the palm or belly of it, you should squeeze the finger and press the dislocation with your thumb until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Approach should be to support the head of the finger, and suspend the part where it is dislocated, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Approach should be to extend it (the dislocated finger) and suspend it until it is straightened on that same day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	When night comes, you should follow this procedure, and do not cease to loosen it during the day and exercise movement, and leave it at night; do so for several days until it is strengthened.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	Do the same thing if it is dislocated in the belly of the hand, and leave it to that location and perform the first operation as described above, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	Do the same thing when it is dislocated in other locations.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the treatment of dislocation of spondylus (vertebra) of the back (spine).
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When one of the vertebrae in the back or neck experiences complete dislocation and remains displaced from its place, there is no cure for it as death approaches the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	The sign of this is that the patient's bowel movement is out of their control and they cannot retain it; many times various body parts or legs or arms, or one of them, are weakened, or a vertebra has been displaced from its place, because weakness means that a vertebra has been dislocated and it is removed in four pieces.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, it has been removed in pieces at the back and is called gibbosity.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the cure for it is to consider whether gibbosity occurs in childhood, because in that case there is neither a cure nor healing of the entire body.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in cases caused by accidents or blows or similar to these, the Ancients described the methods of cure at length, but I have abridged it from that source for a shorter explanation, since it is closer to the clearer exposition, which I have expanded and arranged using various instruments, with which I will show you and expand upon it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	I say that in gibbosity caused by the front part of the foot, there is neither cure nor healing for it; similarly, in those that are made on both sides.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And the one that occurs in the back is not cured except for that which I recommend.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	The patient should be extended on their back close to a wall with their feet stretched out so that the walls do not touch their feet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And a straight staff should be placed nearby, fixed into the ground at the foot of the patient around their head, and another staff on the other side to elevate their feet at the other end of the staff.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	The minister should hold the staff, and it should not be fixed in a pit; another minister should hold the other according to that shape.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And cover the patient's head with a cloth and tighten it around their forehead firmly; extend the end of the linen to the staff that should support their head, and tie it there; strengthen another linen across their buttocks, under their arms, and over their chest, and hold it by the feet; then adjust all the linens and tie them to the other staff that should support their feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the minister should extend each linen to the end of the staff, and neither should the two staffs and linens at their respective locations where they are fixed be removed, but rather leave them as I have said before.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	The doctor should place their hands firmly on the vertebra until it returns, or they should place a table under it and make sure that their feet are adjusted on the table until it returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return in this way, then take a table whose width or length is about three feet and carve into the wall near the patient's head a hole where the end of the table fits.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	Then place the tabletop on the vertebra and the doctor should place their feet on the other end of the table, pulling strongly until the vertebra is dislocated and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, open the hole that is twisted with the hand; and it is that you squat in front of the patient's head at the end of two staffs, whose length should be one arm, and the distance between each staff should be one palm, and a groove should be made in each staff for the turning rod to pass through, and each rod should be firmly fixed on the ground so that it is not damaged.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should also be a round staff with the turning hole in both grooves of the two staffs.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a groove in which the round rod with a length of one palm rotates; and the same applies to the other two staffs.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	Then strengthen the linens that you have stretched in the patient's feet on the groove that should support their head, and the linens that you have stretched in their chest on the turning rod that should support their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And you should also have each turn and a minister who turns the rod with their hand, while the doctor holds the vertebra as previously mentioned.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the shape of the turning rod:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	When the vertebra has returned and the location is covered, it is necessary to apply an adhesive plaster with egg white, and then stop it; then place a wooden splint on top of the plaster that is three fingers wide or more, and the length is the measurement taken at the site of the gibbosity, and above the edge of the vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And let the patient use the linen that we mentioned for nourishment until they are healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	If there is still a weakness in the location at the end of the healing process, it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and liniment it for a long time with the administration of the table, which we have recommended; and a lead sheet has already been administered in that location.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes the imminence occurs in the lower part of the spine, called dislocation; and that bone is already inclined to such a condition so that it is not necessary to make an opening for it with this medicine, because great force may cause death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter thirty-one.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On treating a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not move but only dislocate, and it does not happen to those that happens to other joints due to small displacement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	The hip joint can be dislocated in four ways: it can be dislocated inside the pelvis, outside the pelvis, in front, or behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	Most commonly, it is dislocated inside the pelvis, and rarely in front or behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	The sign of the dislocation in the pelvis is when, when you align the healthy person's hip with the patient's, the healthy one appears longer and its tip is more prominent than the patient's, and the patient cannot bend their leg. You should anoint the area with cauterized dressing, so that the head of the dislocated bone has already been reached.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	The sign of the dislocation that occurs outside the pelvis is that the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	The sign of the dislocation that occurs in front is that the thigh expands according to its natural shape, but it does not bend without pain at the tip, and if it is forced to move, it cannot go forward; the urine is retained and the dressing must be applied to it, and you should walk on your heels.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	The sign of the dislocation that occurs behind is that the tip does not extend and cannot bend the front part where it bends the dressing, and the thigh is shorter than the other, and the dressing is softened, and you should reach for the head of the dislocated bone there.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of the types of this dislocation is that you consider whether the dislocation is old and ancient, in which case it has already become fixed in its position, in which case it is not a cure; therefore, it is not necessary to make an opening for it.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the case of a recent dislocation (one of the four types of dislocations), you should try to move the joint and extend it in both directions, left and right, because great force will return it and it does not need any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If it does not return in this way, then you must prepare strong medicine and extend the thigh of the affected side from the lower part, or with your hands, or apply a ligament on top of the thigh below the tip; and another minister should extend their hand above it as far as possible to press down on the dislocated bone; and another minister should press strongly on the ligament near the root of the joint, and another minister should hold the end of the ligament firmly.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	The extension of the limb or from the pelvis to the ankle, or from the back to the lower back.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And the extension should be done all at once while the patient is lifted off the ground and remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This type of extension is common to all four types.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	Therefore, if the dislocation returns with what has been said, it will be good; and if not, it is necessary for all types to follow the instructions for their own treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the dislocated part, when it is within the joints, it is necessary that the patient lies on their side; then place cushions under the affected area where the head of the dislocation is located and the site to be reduced, extending the limb in the direction opposite the dislocation to the same side of the clavicle.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And take another strong servant and grasp the patient's arms, and forcefully pull the affected joint in the opposite direction to extend it wide apart, because that will return it to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type of treatment is for light cure, in which the limb can be reduced more easily than by other types.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if the patient resists and refuses to cooperate with this type of treatment, it is necessary that both of their feet be bound tightly, loosely, around both the ankles and wrists.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let each side be of four fingers in length, and the affected area should be extended more than the other by two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And suspend the patient over the head of the post (or bed), so that they are in the highest position possible; and let their feet be two arm-lengths away from the ground.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong young man to grasp the head of the dislocated joint, and suspend another young man from the patient. The third young man should push on the affected joint with force, because the joint will return to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the reduction of a dislocation outside the joint, it is necessary for the patient to lie face down as previously recommended; and tie the affected area tightly with ropes around the chest and feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two posts should be placed, one at the feet and the other at the head; and posts adjusted to the middle of the beam fixed above on which damp cloths are wrapped, so that the patient is not damaged by the post being between their thighs, so that the extension at the affected joint is not restricted.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each servant should extend their part, and the doctor with his hand guides the reduction according to the art (or technique).
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	So if the patient complies, it will be very good; but if they resist, hold them down carefully and guide them as previously recommended.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But the patient must lie face down.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the front joint, it should be extended slightly and in accordance with this narrative on the beam (or post). The doctor places his right hand on the affected limb, and with the other hand he compresses that area, and with that compression, he extends the affected arm to the opposite side of the hip.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back joint, it should not be extended to the opposite side, but raised above the ground; and it should be placed on a hard surface, as in the case where an ankle is dislocated outside the joint, as previously discussed about the position of the patient on two cushions, and his face should be placed down, and the limbs should be extended, as previously mentioned, which will not cause harm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is necessary to apply compression with a table on the site where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	So, as the reduction is complex, and the method of reducing it is not hidden from you (you will be extending the patient's legs), when you see them straightened out with no resistance, you will know that the limb, according to what is necessary, has been returned. Then you adjust the thighs and bind them tightly with bandages so that the affected area does not become swollen in any direction; and keep the patient resting for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And loosen the bandage and the padding, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see them straightened out in their proper position, then you will know that the dislocation is already fixed, and at this point, let the patient get up.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	If you see any signs of swelling, then return and treat that area, extend it according to your first structure, and let it rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And loosen that area, and make it walk slowly on crutches for several days until it is comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter XXXII.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of dislocation of the ankle.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The ankle can be dislocated in three ways: it is dislocated outside the joint, inside the joint, and more often behind the joint; but not in front of the joint.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	The sign of a dislocation is that you command the patient to move their ankle, and then you will know that the ankle is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	The restoration of all three types of dislocations is that you straighten the patient's leg, so that they can extend their ankle if possible; place your hands on the sides of it, and hold their foot between your feet; and grasp the ankle with both hands and keep them apart from each other with force, and another servant extends his foot until the ankle returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The thigh bone adheres to the hip without moving away.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Apply that and let the thigh bone adhere to the hip, and apply bandages for three or four days, then remove them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not make the patient walk for several days until he is healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	If the reduction cannot be accomplished, then administer strong extension with ligaments as mentioned in the treatment of the thigh.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Treatment for the Dislocation of the Ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle is sometimes moved slightly out of place by accident, and at other times it is dislocated due to trauma, and the dislocation occurs either inside the joint or outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	The sign of ankle dislocation is that the ankle appears swollen around the area where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	However, the treatment for a slight displacement is easy reduction, and it should be extended with ease and then returned to its normal position.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	If the dislocation occurs due to trauma, one must first immobilize the patient correctly, and have a strong and capable assistant from behind the feet in the correct position.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	Place your right hand on the upper part of the patient's foot and your left hand on the lower part of the foot near the heel in the location of the cavity.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	Pull the foot towards you with your right hand and push it away from you twice with your left hand, extending it, then push on the front of the shinbone with your left hand while pushing backward on the heel with your right hand to force the bones into their proper alignment.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	Do this as many times as necessary until you achieve the desired result.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Push the shinbone toward the hip one last time, and you are at the joint.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, if it returns in one or two days using this method and the foot appears swollen, that is good; otherwise, repeat the operation as it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	If the reduction of it is forbidden as prescribed by what you have recommended, then place the patient on their back on the ground, stretch out a flat stone on the ground, and let them lower themselves onto it so that they rest between their thighs, and you have already covered them with cloth to prevent discomfort for the patient.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And place the minister in charge of it with their knees, and another minister should extend the foot with their hands or secure it with ropes around the neck of the foot; and each minister should extend that part as far as they can, and the stone should remain between the patient's thighs to hold it in place so that the body is not torn apart at the sides.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor should compress the dislocation with their hands, and another minister should hold the healthy part at the sides, as the dislocation will return easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and you have confirmed the health of the reduction of it, then stop applying the plaster and remove it firmly, and tie the leg to the bed.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And be careful or protect yourself from the nerves that are located behind the ankle, so that the ropes around it are not tight and do not hurt it too much.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And keep it like that for two or three days; if the ropes become softened, remove them.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	Then untie it on the third or fourth day, and forbid the patient from walking for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to go in front of that space, it is not certain that the dislocation will not be dissolved and corrupted, and approach what does not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if it turns into a cauterized abscess, you must administer the prescribed treatment in the location of cure and dressing mentioned in our narrative until it heals over.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter XXXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the cure of dislocation of the fingers of the feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It must be compressed gently without much extension; and that is not difficult, it is easy to do so.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in one of the toes of the foot, it must be compressed with the patient's foot on a level surface such as the ground or a table, and remain like that as if walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And you stand by the patient, and place your foot on top of what supports the joints, and press down on it with your foot using force until it returns, and make sure that it remains compressed and does not appear again in the elevated area.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And place the patient's foot on a table that holds the entire foot, which has two arms, and strengthen it with a suitable and secure structure for three days; then remove it and allow it to rest from walking until it is strengthened and the reduction is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the types of dislocation caused by a wound, fracture, or any combination thereof.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When one of those occurs and you engage in the cure and restoration of it, many times death occurs after several days.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore, in the treatment of it, do not presume without being knowledgeable and experienced in the art, long practice, mercy, compassion, patience, humility, and modesty; use medicines that dissolve cauterized abscesses only, and leave the patient to divine judgment, but help the one you hope will be saved from destruction, with relief from pain, and in which you see some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore, strive to make the reduction at the beginning of the cause before abscesses occur.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And therefore, if the member returns as desired, then administer the treatment that dissolves cauterized abscesses and heals the wound with what is appropriate for dry dressings.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is accompanied by fracture and separate bone fragments, you should perform the setting of them, and do what we said in simple fractures as mentioned in those places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	Keep and avoid what we have mentioned in the paths of fear as preceded by my teachings; for that is better for you, it will please your Creator, and more persistent to your glory, and healthier to your true body in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Al-Zahrawi, may God be pleased with him.
Amen.	Amen.
